thread.title: Sarawak cops arrest duo over false FB posts - Nation | The Star Online
thread.title_full: Sarawak cops arrest duo over false FB posts - Nation | The Star Online

author: Stephen Then
title: Sarawak cops arrest duo over false FB posts - Nation | The Star Online
text:
Wednesday, 22 February 2017 | MYT 11:19 AM Sarawak cops arrest duo over false FB posts by stephen then This facebook posting about child kidnapping in Sarawak is false said the state police. 
MIRI: Sarawak police raided the homes of two men in the around midnight and 2am and arrested them for posting fake news about child-kidnapping in Sarawak on Facebook. 
State CID chief Senior Asst Comm Datuk Dev Kumar said the cops arrested a security guard and a driver, both of them in Sibu town at about 11.30 pm and 2am. 
Nabbed at separate locations and both have allegedly confessed to having posted fake news about two women going around kidnapping small children in the state. 
"The duo had copied and pasted Facebook postings alleging that the police had issued a warning to the public about a child kidnapping syndicate operating in Sibujaya. 
"We police have not issued any such warnings. 
"The postings claimed that we police had issued the warning specifically to schools to be wary of two women who were part of that child kidnapping syndicate. 
"The postings also alleged that the police are hunting three men who are part of this syndicate who are using a heavily tinted car. "The postings also have two photos of the women kidnappers. 
"A police probe showed there is no truth to such child kidnapping incidents in Sarawak," he said. 
SAC Dev said the police will cite the duo for committing offences under the Multimedia and Communications Act. 
He said the police had already made numerous arrests in recent weeks in Sarawak relating to such fake news on Facebook. 
He again warned the people not to spread such news without checking with the police.
